title: Grade 4 Mathematics
teaser: Operations and algebraic thinking, number and operations in base ten and fractions.

children.title: Place Value, Rounding, And Algorithms For Addition And Subtraction
children.teaser: Students work with large numbers on the place values chart.

children.title: Place Value Of Multi-Digit Whole Numbers
children.teaser: Recognize that in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents ten times what it represents in the place to its right.

children.title: Interpret A Multiplication Equation As A Comparison
children.teaser: Students interpret a multiplication comparison, develop fluency and concept development

children.title: Recognize A Digit Represents 10 Times The Representative To Its Right
children.teaser: Students recognize a digit represents 10 times the value of what the number represents to its right.

children.title: Numbers To 1 Million Using Place Value Charts With Commas
children.teaser: Students name numbers within 1 million using place value charts and placement of commas

children.title: Multi-Digit Numbers, Base Ten Numerals, Number Names
children.teaser: Students read and write multi-digit numbers using base ten numerals, number names, and expanded form.

children.title: Comparing Multi-Digit Whole Numbers Using Place Value
children.teaser: Students compare Multi-Digit Whole Numbers initially using the place value chart, then compare the value of each digit to surmise greater value.

children.title: Comparison Based On Meanings Of The Digits
children.teaser: Students compare numbers based on meanings of the digits using >, <,or = to record the comparison.

children.title: Find More And Less Than A GivenNumber
children.teaser: Find 1, 10, and 100 thousand more and less than a givennumber.

children.title: Rounding Multi-Digit  Numbers
children.teaser: Students will round Multi-Digit Whole Numbers

children.title: Round Numbers Using The VerticalNumber Line
children.teaser: Students will round multi-digit numbers to any place using the verticalnumber line.

children.title: Round Multi-Digit Numbers Using The Vertical Number Line
children.teaser: Students will continue to round multi-digit numbers to any place using the verticalnumber line.

children.title: Use Place Value Understanding To Round Multi-Digit Numbers To Any Place Value
children.teaser: Use place value understanding to round multi-digit numbers toany place value.

children.title: Round Multi-Digit Numbers Using Real World Applications
children.teaser: Use place value understanding to round multi-digit numbers toany place value using real world applications.

children.title: Multi-Digit Whole Number Addition
children.teaser: Students develop fluency with the standard addition algorithm.

children.title: Multi-Digit Addition To Solve Word Problems Using Tape Diagrams
children.teaser: Add multi-digit whole numbers addition to solve word problems using tape diagrams.

children.title: Multi-Step Word Problems With Tape Diagrams Using Rounding
children.teaser: Students will solve multi-step word problems, use tape diagrams, and round numbers.

children.title: Multi-Digit Whole Number Subtraction
children.teaser: Students begin working with the standard algorithm.

children.title: Place Value Subtraction
children.teaser: Place value standard subtraction algorithm to  word problems using tape diagrams.

children.title: Place Value Subtraction Algorithm And Word Problems
children.teaser: Place value units up to 3 times using standard subtraction algorithms, solve word problems

children.title: Decomposing Smaller Units Multiple Times Using Tape Diagrams
children.teaser: Students will use place value to decompose  smaller units multiple times using tape diagrams.

children.title: Two-Step Word Problems
children.teaser: Students will work with two-step word problems, tape diagrams, and  answers using rounding.

children.title: Addition And Subtraction Word Problems
children.teaser: Students solve problems using tape diagrams.

children.title: Compare Word Problems Modeled With Tape Diagrams
children.teaser: Students will  compare word problems modeled with tape diagrams.

children.title: Two-Step Word Problems And Rounding
children.teaser: Students will solve two-step word problems, use tape diagrams and assess answers using rounding.

children.title: Multi-Step Word Problems
children.teaser: Students will work with multi-step word problems from given tape diagrams and equations.

children.title: Multi-Step Word Problems And Equations
children.teaser: Students will solve multi-step word problems from given tape diagrams and equations.

children.title: Metric Unit Conversions
children.teaser: Students connect their familiarity with both metric units and place value.

children.title: Metric Length Measurements
children.teaser: Students will express metric length measurements in terms of a smaller unit.

children.title: Express Metric Mass Measurements
children.teaser: Express metric mass measurements in terms of a smaller unit

children.title: Express Metric Capacity Measurements
children.teaser: Students express metric capacity measurements in terms of a smaller unit

children.title: Metric Unit Conversions
children.teaser: Students will work with application of Metric Unit Conversions

children.title: Multi-Step Word Problems: Length, Mass, And Capacity
children.teaser: Students will solve multi-step word problems involving length, mass, and capacity.

children.title: Metric Unit And Place Value
children.teaser: Students will know and relate metric units to place value in different units.

children.title: Multi-Digit Multiplication And Division
children.teaser: Students will use Multi-Digit numbers in Multiplication and Division

children.title: Multiplicative Comparison Word Problems
children.teaser: Students will work with multiplicative comparison word problems

children.title: Area And Perimeter Of Rectangles
children.teaser: Students will investigate and use  formulas for area and perimeter of rectangles.

children.title: Multiplicative Comparison Word Problems: Area And Perimeter Formulas
children.teaser: Students will solve multiplicative comparison word problems using area and perimeter formulas.

children.title: Area And Perimeter Formulas: Real World Problems
children.teaser: Students will address area and perimeter formulas by solving multi-step real world problems.

children.title: Multiplication By 10, 100, And 1,000
children.teaser: Students will work with multiplication by 10, 100, and 1,000

children.title: Patterns When Multiplying In Arrays And Numerically
children.teaser: Students will interpret and represent patterns when multiplying in arrays and numerically.

children.title: Multiply Multiples Of 10, 100, 1,000
children.teaser: Students will multiply multiples of 10, 100, 1,000 using single digits and patterns.

children.title: Multiplying Multiples By Two-Digit Multiples Of 10
children.teaser: Students will multiplying multiples by two-digit multiples of 10 using area

children.title: Multiplying Four Digits By Single-Digit Numbers
children.teaser: Students will work with multiplication of up to Four Digits by Single-Digit Numbers

children.title: Two-Digit By One-Digit Multiplication
children.teaser: Students will work with place value representing two-digit by one-digit multiplication.

children.title: Three/Four-Digit By One-Digit Multiplication
children.teaser: Students will work with place value in three/four-digit by one-digit multiplication.

children.title: Three/Four-Digit Numbers By One-Digit
children.teaser: Multiply three/four-digit numbers by one-digit

children.title: Multiplying Three- And Four-Digit Numbers By One-Digit Numbers
children.teaser: Students will multiply three- and four-digit numbers by one-digit numbers

children.title: Area Model And The Partial Products Method
children.teaser: Students will connect the area model and the partial products method.

children.title: Multiplication Word Problems
children.teaser: Students use a combination of addition, subtraction, and multiplication to solve.

children.title: Two-Step Word Problems
children.teaser: Two-step word problems, including multiplicative comparison.

children.title: Multi-Step Word Problems
children.teaser: Multiplication, addition, or subtraction solving multi-step word problems.

children.title: Division Of Tens And Ones
children.teaser: Division of Tens and Ones with Successive Remainders

children.title: Division With Remainders
children.teaser: Solve division word problems with remainders.

children.title: Solve Division Problems With Remainders Using Arrays And Area Models
children.teaser: Solve division problems with remainders using arrays and area models.

children.title: Two-Digit Dividend Division Problems With Remainders Using Number Disks
children.teaser: Solve two-digit dividend division problems with remainders in the ones place using number disks.

children.title: Solve Division Problems Requiring Decomposing A Remainder In The Tens
children.teaser: Represent and solve division problems requiring decomposing a remainder in the tens.

children.title: Find Whole Number Quotients And Remainders
children.teaser: Find whole number quotients and remainders.

children.title: Explain Remainders By Using Place Value Understanding And Models
children.teaser: Explain remainders by using place value understanding and models.

children.title: Solve Division Problems Without Remainders Using The Area Model
children.teaser: Solve division problems without remainders using the area model.

children.title: Solve Division Problems With Remainders Using The Area Model
children.teaser: Solve division problems with remainders using the area model.

children.title: Divisibility
children.teaser: Reasoning with Divisibility

children.title: Factor Pairs For Numbers To 100 To Define Prime And Composite
children.teaser: Find factor pairs for numbers to 100 to define prime and composite.

children.title: Use Division And The Associative Property To Test For Factors And Observe Patterns
children.teaser: Use division and the associative property to test for factors and observe patterns.

children.title: Determine That Whole Numbers Are A Multiple Of Another Number
children.teaser: Determine whether a whole number is a multiple of another number.

children.title: Properties Of Prime And Composite Numbers To 100, Using Multiples
children.teaser: Explore properties of prime and composite numbers to 100 by using multiples.

children.title: Thousands, Hundreds, Tens, Ones
children.teaser: Division of Thousands, Hundreds, Tens, and Ones

children.title: Divide Multiples Of 10, 100, And 1,000
children.teaser: Divide multiples of 10, 100, and 1,000 by single-digit numbers.

children.title: Solve Division Problems With Three-Digit Dividends, Number Disks, Remainders
children.teaser: Solve division problems with a three-digit dividend numerically, number disks, decomposing remainders

children.title: Divisors Of 2, 3, 4, And 5
children.teaser: Represent and solve three-digit dividend division with divisors of 2, 3, 4, and 5 numerically.

children.title: Four-Digit Dividend Division With Divisors, Decomposing Remainders Three Times
children.teaser: Four-digit dividend division with divisors of 2, 3, 4, and 5, decomposing a remainder up to three times.

children.title: Solve Division Problems With A Zero As Dividend Or Quotient
children.teaser: Solve division problems with a zero in the dividend or with a zero in the quotient.

children.title: Interpret Division Word Problems As Either Number Of Groups Unknown Or Group Size Unknown
children.teaser: Interpret division word problems as either number of groups unknown or group size unknown.

children.title: Finding Quotients And Remainders To Solve One-Step Division Word Problems
children.teaser: Finding quotients and remainders to solve one-step division word problems with larger divisors

children.title: Area Models Of Division For Long Division Algorithm With Dividends
children.teaser: Connecting area models of division to long division algorithm for dividends.

children.title: Multiply Two-Digits By Two-Digits
children.teaser: Multiplication of Two-Digit by Two-Digit Numbers

children.title: Multiply Two-Digit Multiples Of 10: Place Value Chart
children.teaser: Multiply two-digit multiples of 10 by two-digit numbers using a place value chart.

children.title: Multiply Two-Digit Multiples Of 10: Area Model
children.teaser: Multiply two-digit multiples of 10 by two-digit numbers using the area model.

children.title: Multiply Two-Digits By Two-Digits: Partial Products
children.teaser: Multiply two-digit by two-digit numbers using four partial products.

children.title: Two-Digit Multiplication: Standard Algorithms
children.teaser: Transition from four partial products to the standard algorithm for two-digit by two-digit multiplication (Day 1).

children.title: Two-Digit Multiplication: Standard Algorithms (Continued)
children.teaser: Transition from four partial products to the standard algorithm for two-digit by two-digit multiplication (Day 2).

children.title: Angle Measure And Plane Figures
children.teaser: Introduction to points, lines, line segments, rays, and angles.

children.title: Lines And Angles
children.teaser: Students drawing points, lines, line segments, and rays.

children.title: Identify And Draw Points, Lines, Rays, Angles With Recognition
children.teaser: Identify and draw points, lines, line segments, rays, angles and recognize them in various contexts

children.title: Angles: Equal To, Greater, Or Less Than 90 Degrees
children.teaser: Right angles to determine  angles are equal to, greater than, or less than, right angles.

children.title: Perpendicular Lines
children.teaser: Identify, define, and draw perpendicular lines.

children.title: Parallel Lines
children.teaser: Identify, define, and draw parallel lines.

children.title: Angle Measurement
children.teaser: Students explore the definition of degree measure.

children.title: 1-Degree Angle And Exploring Angles
children.teaser: Circular protractors to understand a 1-degree angle and exploring benchmark angles with protractors

children.title: Angle Measure And Length Measurement
children.teaser: Use varied protractors to distinguish angle measure from length measurement.

children.title: Measure And Draw Angles
children.teaser: Measure and draw angles.  Sketch given angle measures and verify with a protractor.

children.title: Identify And Measure Angles
children.teaser: Identify and measure angles as turns and recognize them in various contexts.

children.title: Addition Of Angle Measures
children.teaser: Problem Solving with the Addition of Angle Measures

children.title: Decompose Angles
children.teaser: Decompose angles using pattern blocks.

children.title: Addition Of Adjacent Angle Measures
children.teaser: Addition of adjacent angle measures to solve problems with symbols for unknown angles (Day 1).

children.title: Addition Of Adjacent Angle Measures (Continued)
children.teaser: Addition of adjacent angle measures to solve problems with symbols for unknown angles (Day 2).

children.title: Two-Dimensional Figures And Symmetry
children.teaser: Students identify and classify figures.

children.title: Line-Symmetric Figures
children.teaser: Recognize lines of symmetry for given two-dimensional figures; identify line-symmetric figures and lines

children.title: Analyze And Classify Triangles
children.teaser: Analyze and classify triangles based on side length, angle measure or both.

children.title: Define And Construct Triangles
children.teaser: Define and construct triangles from given criteria.  Explore symmetry in triangles.

children.title: Classify Quadrilaterals
children.teaser: Classify quadrilaterals, parallel and perpendicular lines and the presence or absence of angles

children.title: Construct Quadrilaterals
children.teaser: Reason about attributes to construct quadrilaterals on square or triangular grid paper.

children.title: Fraction Equivalence, Ordering, And Operations
children.teaser: Students explore fraction equivalence and mixed numbers.

children.title: Decomposition And Fraction Equivalence
children.teaser: Students decompose fractions and create tape diagrams to represent them.

children.title: Decompose Fractions
children.teaser: Decompose fractions as a sum of unit fractions using tape diagrams (Day 1).

children.title: Decompose Fractions (Continued)
children.teaser: Decompose fractions as a sum of unit fractions using tape diagrams using tape diagrams (Day 2).

children.title: Decompose Non-Unit Fractions
children.teaser: Decompose non-unit fractions as a whole number times a unit fraction using tape diagrams.

children.title: Decompose Fractions Into Sums
children.teaser: Decompose fractions into sums of smaller unit fractions using tape diagrams.

children.title: Decompose Unit Fractions Using Area Models
children.teaser: Decompose unit fractions using area models to show equivalence.

children.title: Decompose Fractions Using Area Models
children.teaser: Decompose fractions using area models to show equivalence.

children.title: Fraction Equivalence Using Multiplication And Division
children.teaser: students use tape diagrams and area models to create an equivalent fraction.

children.title: Area Models, Multiplication And Equivalence Fractions
children.teaser: Use the area model and multiplication to show the equivalence of two fractions (Day 1).

children.title: Area Models, Multiplication And Equivalence Fractions (Continued)
children.teaser: Use the area model and multiplication to show the equivalence of two fractions (Day 2).

children.title: Area Models, Division And Equivalence Fractions
children.teaser: Use the area model and division to show the equivalence of two fractions (Day 1).

children.title: Area Models, Division And Equivalence Fractions (Continued)
children.teaser: Use the area model and division to show the equivalence of two fractions (Day 2).

children.title: Fraction Equivalence: Tape Diagrams, Number Lines
children.teaser: Fraction equivalence with tape diagrams, number lines, and relation of multiplication and division.

children.title: Fraction Comparison
children.teaser: Students reason about fractions with unlike denominators.

children.title: Compare Fractions On Number Lines
children.teaser: Reason using benchmarks to compare two fractions on the number line (Day 1).

children.title: Compare Fractions On Number Lines (Continued)
children.teaser: Reason using benchmarks to compare two fractions on the number line (Day 2).

children.title: Compare Fractions
children.teaser: Find common units or number of units to compare two fractions (Day 1).

children.title: Compare Fractions (Continued)
children.teaser: Find common units or number of units to compare two fractions (Day 2).

children.title: Fraction Addition And Subtraction
children.teaser: Students apply understanding of whole number addition and subtraction to fractions.

children.title: Add And Subtract Fractions: Visual Models
children.teaser: Use visual models to add and subtract two fractions with the same units.

children.title: Add And Subtract Fractions With Same Units
children.teaser: Use visual models to add and subtract two fractions with same units, including one whole.

children.title: Add And Subtract More Than Two Fractions
children.teaser: Students use models to add and subtract more than two fractions.

children.title: Fraction Addition And Subtraction: Word Problems
children.teaser: Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of  fractions.

children.title: Add Fractions With Related Units
children.teaser: Use visual models to add two fractions with related units using the denominators (Day 1).

children.title: Add Fractions With Related Units (Continued)
children.teaser: Use visual models to add two fractions with related units using the denominators (Day 2).

children.title: Fractions Greater Than 1
children.teaser: Extending Fraction Equivalence to Fractions Greater than 1

children.title: Add Or Subtract A Fraction Less Than 1 From A Whole Number
children.teaser: Add a fraction less than 1 to, or subtract a fraction less than 1 from a whole number using decomposition and visual models

children.title: Add And Multiply Unit Fractions
children.teaser: Add and multiply unit fractions to build fractions greater than 1 using visual models.

children.title: Decompose And Compose Fractions Greater Than 1
children.teaser: Decompose and compose fractions greater than 1 to express them in various forms (Day 1).

children.title: Decompose And Compose Fractions Greater Than 1 (Continued)
children.teaser: Decompose and compose fractions greater than 1 to express them in various forms (Day 2).

children.title: Compare Fractions Greater Than 1: Benchmarks
children.teaser: Compare fractions greater than 1 by reasoning using benchmark fractions.

children.title: Compare Fractions Greater Than 1: Common Units
children.teaser: Compare fractions greater than 1, creating common numerators or denominators.

children.title: Word Problems With Line Plots
children.teaser: Solve fraction word problems with line plots.

children.title: Addition And Subtraction Of Fractions By Decomposition
children.teaser: students estimate sums and differences of mixed numbers.

children.title: Estimate Sums And Differences
children.teaser: Estimate sums and differences using benchmark numbers.

children.title: Add Mixed Numbers And Fractions
children.teaser: Students add a mixed number and a fraction.

children.title: Add Mixed Numbers
children.teaser: Students add two mixed numbers.

children.title: Subtract A Fraction From A Mixed Number
children.teaser: Students subtract a fraction from a mixed number, using three main strategies.

children.title: Subtract A Mixed Number From A Mixed Number
children.teaser: Students subtract a mixed number from a mixed number using three main strategies.

children.title: Subtract Mixed Numbers
children.teaser: Students subtract mixed numbers.

children.title: Repeated Addition Of Fractions As Multiplication
children.teaser: Students use the associative property and their understanding of decomposition.

children.title: Represent The Multiplication Of "N"
children.teaser: Represent the multiplication of "n" using the associative property and visual models (Day 1).

children.title: Represent The Multiplication Of "N" (Continued)
children.teaser: Represent the multiplication of "n" using the associative property and visual models (Day 2).

children.title: Products Of Whole Numbers And Mixed Numbers
children.teaser: Find products of whole numbers and mixed numbers using the distributive property (Day 1).

children.title: Products Of Whole Numbers And Mixed Numbers (Continued)
children.teaser: Find products of whole numbers and mixed numbers using the distributive property (Day 2).

children.title: Multiplicative Comparison Involving Fractions
children.teaser: Solve multiplicative comparison word problems involving fractions.

children.title: Multiplication Of Whole Numbers And Fractions: Word Problems
children.teaser: Word problems involving  multiplication of whole numbers and fractions including those involving line plots.

children.title: Explore A Fraction Pattern
children.teaser: Find fraction patterns through sums and differences.

children.title: Utilize Patterns To Calculate Sums Of Fractional Parts Between 0 And 1
children.teaser: Utilize patterns to calculate sums of fractional parts between 0 and 1. Share and critique peer strategies.

children.title: Decimal Fractions
children.teaser: Students discover the relationship between decimals and fractions.

children.title: Exploration Of Tenths
children.teaser: Students explore tenths and decimals and fractions.

children.title: Metric Measurement: Decomposition Into Tenths
children.teaser: Use metric measurement to model the decomposition of one whole into tenths.

children.title: Metric Measurement And Area Models
children.teaser: Use metric measurement and area models to represent tenths as fractions and decimal numbers.

children.title: Mixed Numbers: Units Of Tens, Ones, And Tenths
children.teaser: Represent mixed numbers, units of tens, ones, and tenths with number disks, on number lines

children.title: Tenths And Hundredths
children.teaser: Students decompose tenths into 10 equal parts.

children.teaser: Use meters to model the decomposition of one whole into hundredths and represent and count hundredths.

children.title: Equivalence Of Tenths And Hundredths
children.teaser: Model the equivalence of tenths and hundredths using the area model and number disks.

children.title: Represent Mixed Numbers In Different Forms
children.teaser: Use area models and number lines to represent mixed numbers.

children.teaser: Model mixed numbers written in expanded form on the place value chart.

children.teaser: Use understanding of fraction equivalence to investigate decimal numbers on the place value chart.

children.teaser: Use the place value chart and metric measurement to compare decimals.

children.teaser: Compare and order mixed numbers in various forms.

children.teaser: Students recognize that they must convert the addends to the same units.

children.teaser: Apply understanding of fraction equivalence to add tenths and hundredths.

children.teaser: Add decimal numbers by converting to fraction form.
